column2: The Diligent Ones is an old monastic community with 'Ora et Labora', meaning 'pray and labor', as their motto. Often recognized by their black habits, they worship [catholic.GetHighGodName] and find purpose in prayer and quiet contemplation as well as scholarly work.

The Benedictine Order is an old monastic community with 'Ora et Labora', meaning 'pray and labor', as their motto. Often recognized by their black habits, they worship God and find purpose in prayer and quiet contemplation as well as scholarly work.

Members of [buddhist.GetName] monasteries are expected to follow a strict set of rules aiming to attain enlightenment through a simple and meditative life. Foreswearing all physical property except the bare necessities.

Members of Buddhist monasteries are expected to follow a strict set of rules aiming to attain Nirvana through a simple and meditative life. Foreswearing all physical property except the bare necessities Bhikkus vow to live only of what others give them.

The Inquisitors are able to listen to the confessions of any [christian.GetGroupName] – dressed in white and black, they lead the holy inquisition, charged with a mission to identify heretics. As a lay member of their Order you are expected to not pursue material wealth, but strive to be a seeker of truth.

The Dominican Order are able to listen to the confessions of any Christian – dressed in white and black, they lead the holy inquisition, charged with a mission to identify heretics. As a lay member of their Order you are expected to not pursue material wealth, but strive to be a seeker of truth.

The Monks of the [hindu.GetName] Mathas aim to be an integrative and supporting force in society. Monks can seek to achieve spiritual enlightenment through meditation and scriptural studies or through charity and participating in the local economy. The Mathas are honored and often patronized rulers.

The Monks of the Hindu Mathas aim to be an integrative and supporting force in society. Monks can seek to achieve spiritual enlightenment through meditation and scriptural studies or through charity and participating in the local economy. The Mathas are honored and often patronized by the rulers of India.
[jain.GetName] monks swear to abide by a number of vows, regulations, essential duties and restrictions. They dispose of all personal property, seeking purification and self-realization.
Jain monks swear to abide by a number of vows, regulations, essential duties and restrictions. They dispose of all personal property, seeking purification and self-realization.

The Pious Following follows the oldest of monastic rules, set originally by the hallowed martyr. In the spirit of the deserts we value simplicity, submission and humility. It is the duty of [miaphysite.GetName] monks to work to spread the word, building on the oldest [christian.GetName] monastic tradition in the world.

The Community of Saint Anthony follows the oldest of monastic rules, set originally by Saint Anthony of Egypt, Saint Paul of Thebes, Saint Macarius and Saint Pachomius. In the spirit of the Great Fathers of Egypt's deserts we value simplicity, submission and humility. It is the duty of Miaphysite monks to work to spread the word of Christ, building on the oldest Christian monastic tradition in the world.

The Devout Worshipers follow the monastic rules set by the hallowed martyr. Members swear to observe to strict obedience and to spread the word of the three great [nestorian.GetName] doctors. Only the literate may join the order and strict celibacy is required. Study and proselytism are the corner pillars of the order and as a member you are expected to spread the [nestorian.GetName] faith.

The order of Abraham the Great follow the monastic rules set by Abraham of Kashkar. Members swear to observe to strict obedience and to spread the word of the three great Nestorian doctors, Nestorius, Diodore of Tarsus, and Theodore of Mopsuestia. Only the literate may join the order and strict celibacy is required. Study and proselytism are the corner pillars of the order and as a member you are expected to spread the Nestorian faith ever eastwards.

The Faithful Ones lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.

The followers of Saint Basil lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.

The Hellenic School of Stoicism is based on the shunning of excesses and passions in favor of a balanced and rational approach to life, centered around the virtues of Wisdom, Courage, Temperance, and Justice. Most Stoics believe that happiness can be achieved by studying philosophy and leading a virtuous life.

The faithful Aztecs bravely worship their high God, the warrior Huitzilopochtli, despite being surrounded by enemies on every side. If they stay true and send him human sacrifices as gifts, he will lead them to a new dawn, a glorious conquest of fire and blood.

The faithful Aztecs bravely worship their high God, the warrior Huitzilopochtli, despite being surrounded by enemies on every side. If they stay true and send him human sacrifices as gifts, he will lead them to a new dawn, a glorious conquest of fire and blood.

As children of Dievas, the hidden followers of the Baltic faith know that everything is connected through the divine spirit, even those who oppress them. So it is that they continue their work unabated, spreading the words of the High Priest even among those who are at first unwilling to listen. Through the divine commonality of Perkunas, Saule or Daugava, they believe anyone can find a home with them.

As children of Dievas, the hidden followers of the Baltic faith know that everything is connected through the divine spirit, even those who oppress them. So it is that they continue their work unabated, spreading the words of the High Priest even among those who are at first unwilling to listen. Through the divine commonality of Perkunas, Saule or Daugava, they believe anyone can find a home with them.

Bogomilism is a Gnostic sect centered around a dualistic doctrine. Its members believe in two Gods - the good God who is the creator of the heavenly spiritual realm and the evil God who created the physical world with all its temptations and suffering.

Followers of the Bön religion worship many gods and spirits. Adherents seek Great Perfection through the Dzogchen, which is one of the Nine Vehicles (or paths) of the Bön faith. In secret, the Bön Faithful continue to sacrifice animals made of barley flour to appease the higher powers.

Followers of the Bön religion worship many gods and spirits. Adherents seek Great Perfection through the Dzogchen, which is one of the Nine Vehicles (or paths) of the Bön faith. In secret, the Bön Faithful continue to sacrifice animals made of barley flour to appease the higher powers.

Those who secretly follow the teachings of Buddha focus on asceticism and distancing themselves of worldly possessions as much as they can without notice. A belief in rebirth into the wheel of life and death makes them distance themselves of all cravings, which bring only pain. There are those who would rather plant a good karmic seed through rebirth than renounce these teachings, as an open profession of faith is not always needed to grow closer to Nirvana.

Catharism is a Gnostic sect centered around a dualistic doctrine. The Good Christians', as the Cathar faithful calls themselves, believe in two Gods - the good God who is the creator of the heavenly spiritual realm and the evil God who created the physical world with all its temptations and suffering.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

The Druze follow the teachings of the Epistles of Wisdom, which includes the Old Testament, the Qur'an and the philosophical works by Plato. The faithful believe that God is the whole of existence, unlimited and omnipresent. To unite with the Cosmic Mind and reach ultimate happiness, a Druze must live through many successive reincarnations.

Even under the rule of another religion, the Suomenusko faith lives strong in some people. Communing with nature, they find their gods in the quiet places of the world. Among the trees, the brooks and the light of the moon, where they worship their divine kings in secret. But silence does not last forever, and it will soon be shattered by the storming in of Ukko on his chariot of thunder, his bolts of lightning striking the faithless to ash.

Even under the rule of another religion, the Suomenusko faith lives strong in some people. Communing with nature, they find their gods in the quiet places of the world. Among the trees, the brooks and the light of the moon, where they worship their divine kings in secret. But silence does not last forever, and it will soon be shattered by the storming in of Ukko on his chariot of thunder, his bolts of lightning striking the faithless to ash.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

Followers of Hellenism worship the old gods of the ancient Greeks and Romans. Adherents sacrifice animals and calculate the future through astrology, believing their deities to be fickle and passionate beings, largely indifferent to the affairs of mortals.

Followers of Hellenism worship the old gods of the ancient Greeks and Romans. Adherents sacrifice animals and calculate the future through astrology, believing their deities to be fickle and passionate beings, largely indifferent to the affairs of mortals

Followers of Hinduism believe it to be The Eternal Way, and even when forced to utter the blessings of another spirit, some know that in the samsara all things will come to pass, and the natural order of things will return. In the cycle of destruction and creation, death and rebirth, endings and beginnings, no other truth will stand victorious for long.

The Hurufi follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam. They spread their belief that God, through Muhammed, chose Ali as his successor, and thus the first caliph of the state of Islam. They will stand by what they believe to be the true word of God.

The Ibadi faith is said to predate both the Sunni and Shia schools of Islam. There are several doctrinal differences between these later branches and the orthodox Ibadi, for examples, the Ibadi do not believe there has to be one leader for all of the Muslim communities. However, their fervent faith in Allah is the same.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

To conquer all inner passions is to become Jina. The Jains take five vows of self- discipline and asceticism in their search of spiritual development. Ahmisa: to love and cause no harm to other living beings. Satya: to always speak the truth. Asteya: to never take that which is not willingly offered. Brahmacharya: to adopt chastity or celibacy. Aparigraha: the renunciation of worldly possessions. To be Jain is to never break such vows, even when doing so is in itself a secret that tries Satya to its very limits.

Hidden Jewish communities have organized under oppression ever since the time of the Babylonian captivity. These groups welcome both those forced to convert away of Judaism, the Anusim, and those who have secretly become righteous converts, the ger tzedek. A community always cares for its own, knowing that as ages pass, true faith is worth persevering for. God will provide.

Hidden Karaite communities have organized under oppression ever since the time of the Babylonian captivity. These groups welcome both those forced to convert away of Judaism, the Anusim, and those who have secretly become righteous converts, the ger tzedek. A community always cares for its own, knowing that as ages pass, true faith is worth persevering for. God will provide.

The Khawariji follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. Unlike many other Muslim groups, they believe that any righteous and pious Muslim can become caliph, and that is is their duty to revolt against any ruler who deviates from their interpretation of Islam. Martyrdom and dying for Allah is a strong desire among the Khawariji.

The Khurmazta believe that there are two original principles of the universe - the good Light and the evil Darkness. By a cosmic accident, the two has been mixed, and everything is tainted but God. Mankind's purpose is to spread the wisdom of their benevolent God and releasing their own inner Light through good conduct and kind actions.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

The Manichaeans believe that there are two original principles of the universe - the good Light and the evil Darkness. By a cosmic accident, the two has been mixed, and everything is tainted but God. Mankind's purpose is to spread the wisdom of their benevolent God and releasing their own inner Light through good conduct and kind actions.

The Mazdaki believe that there are two original principles of the universe - the good Light and the evil Darkness. By a cosmic accident, the two has been mixed, and everything is tainted but God. Mankind's purpose is to spread the wisdom of their benevolent God and releasing their own inner Light through good conduct and kind actions.

The Messalians, 'the ones who pray', are a Christian sect. They believe that perfection can only be attained by perceiving God as He reveals Himself to the carnal senses. To bring forth such revelations, the only path is prayer - neither the church, baptism or any other sacrament can drive the desires from the soul and invite God.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

Knowing of the inevitable coming of Ragnarok, as foretold in their saga scriptures, Norse believers will work even in secret to prepare the world for the snowy hell of the Fimbulvetr and the great battles of all-consuming fire it presages. Practicing their secret rituals in the name of the Allfather, they will accept any kind of warrior who can stand with them in the struggle against the chaos and desolation that other faiths seem intent on bringing upon the world.

Knowing of the inevitable coming of Ragnarok, as foretold in their saga scriptures, Norse believers will work even in secret to prepare the world for the snowy hell of the Fimbulvetr and the great battles of all-consuming fire it presages. Practicing their secret rituals in the name of the Allfather, they will accept any kind of warrior who can stand with them in the struggle against the chaos and desolation that other faiths seem intent on bringing upon the world.

Seeing themselves as walking in the footsteps of the Apostles who first built the Church in the name of Christ, there are Christians who will not give up their faith, even when circumstance has forced them to renounce their words. They continue the good work, building their faith and their church, knowing in their hearts that they are doing God's will.

Paulicianism is a Gnostic sect centered around a dualistic doctrine. Its members believe in two Gods - the good God who is the creator of the heavenly spiritual realm and the evil God who created the physical world with all its temptations and suffering.
The Riders of the Blue Sky
The Qarmatians reject all claims to the imamate since Muhammad's death and believe in the coming of the Mahdi, who will rid the world of evil and injustice.

The Samaritans believe that they follow the true religion of the Israelites, as it was before the Babylonian Captivity. Their tenants are similar to those of Judaism, but they have their own version of the Torah and pray facing Mount Gerizim, which they believe is the one true sanctuary chosen by God.

The Shiites secretly follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam. They spread their belief that God, through Muhammed, chose Ali as his successor, and thus the first caliph of the state of Islam. They will stand by what they believe to be the true word of god.

Their identities marked by hidden axe amulets illustrating their devotion to Perun, underground Slavic curates pray in wild storms, their voices consumed by the thunder. In time they know that those who hunt them will be as powerless against the coming of Perun as the oak is against the lightning.

Their identities marked by hidden axe amulets illustrating their devotion to Perun, underground Slavic curates pray in wild storms, their voices consumed by the thunder. In time they know that those who hunt them will be as powerless against the coming of Perun as the oak is against the lightning.
The Sunnis secretly follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam.

Followers of Taoism revere Tao, the underlying natural order of the Universe – the active expression of Tao for an individual is Te, the inner virtue. Adherents seek to strengthen their Te and prepare for the day they no longer need to stay hidden.

No matter how far you travel, and no matter what unbelievers say, you are always under the Heavenly Father, and standing upon the Earth Mother. This is how the followers of Tengri can be so certain in their faith that they follow it even in the face of persecution. All they have to do to prove their faith is to lift their eyes towards Tengri of the Blue Sky above, feel the protection nature provides, and let their Wind Horses ride in prayer to a better place.

No matter how far you travel, and no matter what unbelievers say, you are always under the Heavenly Father, and standing upon the Earth Mother. This is how the followers of Tengri can be so certain in their faith that they follow it even in the face of persecution. All they have to do to prove their faith is to lift their eyes towards Tengri of the Blue Sky above, feel the protection nature provides, and let their Wind Horses ride in prayer to a better place.

Ever since its humble roots, Christians have marked themselves by their refusal to abandon their faith in the face of persecution. So it is that a rich tradition of martyrs and underground parishes can give hope to groups of believers in even the darkest of times, no matter what they are outwardly forced to profess. To each other they can profess their true faith in God, and their God is love.

As preachers proselytize, there are those who play their part, but in secret turn to the forces around them. No other gods have shown them the small miracles of the world, or the sheer divinity of life and existence. They tell each other stories of how faith does not reside in some otherworldly realm, but in the trees around them, the rocks by their feet, and the waters they drink of.

As preachers proselytize, there are those who play their part, but in secret turn to the forces around them. No other gods have shown them the small miracles of the world, or the sheer divinity of life and existence. They tell each other stories of how faith does not reside in some otherworldly realm, but in the trees around them, the rocks by their feet, and the waters they drink of.

The Yazidis believe that God created the world and tasked seven holy angels with its care. The first of the angels is the ambivalent Melek Taus, the Peacock Angel, a ruler who causes both good and bad to befall his mortal subjects.
The Zikris follow the teachings of the Quran, believed to have been verbally recited to Muhammed by God. They will proclaim that Muhammed is chosen by God, as prophet and the first Imam.

Believing themselves to be the protectors of understanding and knowledge in a world under the spell of Ahriman's ignorance, Zoroastrians organizing in secret spread the truth and light of Ahura Mazda's wisdom. Charged by their prophet with protecting the water, earth, fire and air, they enlighten others about the struggle between destructive chaos and the good of creation. Even when forced into secrecy there is yet hope, for Zoroaster told of the inevitability of Ahura Mazda's victory.

The secret followers of Zun have little need for foreign faiths. The answer to every theological challenge and every moment of doubt is right in the sky above them, every day, without fail. It is what brings life and hope, deserving of every prostration. Just as Zun never fails to bring warmth to the earth and drive the night away, his followers will rise on the other side of their own long night.

The secret followers of Zun have little need for foreign faiths. The answer to every theological challenge and every moment of doubt is right in the sky above them, every day, without fail. It is what brings life and hope, deserving of every prostration. Just as Zun never fails to bring warmth to the earth and drive the night away, his followers will rise on the other side of their own long night.

You have $VALUE|Y0$ §Y[Player.Society.GetCurrency]§!.\nThis is the currency which you can spend on the various §YPowers§! unlocked by being a member of §Y[Player.Society.GetNameCap]§!.\nYou gain §Y[Player.Society.GetCurrency]§! by completing missions, as well as on a monthly basis. The monthly gain depends on your stats and traits that are associated with the §Y[Player.Society.GetNameCap]§!.
§RYou need to be a member of§! $SOCIETY|Y$ §Rto see a list of all its current members§!

The elusive Assassins consider themselves the true followers of [shiite.GetHighGodName], and will do anything to further the advances of the [shiite.GetName] faith and protect their fellow believers. Consisting of loyal warriors as well as competent spies, wielding manipulation and social skills as expertly as a dagger, they specialize in asymmetrical warfare, striking hard at the heart of their enemies.

The elusive Assassins consider themselves the true followers of Allah, and will do anything to further the advances of Shia Islam and protect their fellow believers. Consisting of loyal warriors as well as competent spies, wielding manipulation and social skills as expertly as a dagger, they specialize in asymmetrical warfare, striking hard at the heart of their enemies.

The secretive cult of Bacchus has always been a plague to the civilized society of Ancient Rome. Members of this cult gather at night to perform obscene rituals to satisfy their most primal instincts, dabbling in sorcery, cannibalism and bestiality.

The Cold Ones believe that certain people are born with witch's blood and it is their blessing to be able to turn to Chernobog, the Black God, to gain power and wealth. They are frowned upon by traditional believers, who would rather call them cursed, as they are rumored to sacrifice humans and commit heinous acts in order to achieve their goals.

The Cult of Kali Purusha worship the demonic aspect of Kali, and refuse the shackles of conventional belief as they see no fault in acts committed out of selfishness. Their spirituality is instead centered around personal gain and lustful endeavors, condemning them in the eyes of traditional believers.

The Plaguebringers worship what traditional believers would call evil spirits, as they curse their enemies with disease and turn to the Erlik, the God of Death, to achieve their personal goals. Most unsettling are the rumors that they carry very little qualms in regards to how this dark favor is gained...

Those who serve the Great Adversary hide in our midst, dedicating their depravities and perfidies to their Lord Satan. Every transgression is a hymn, every murder a roar of defiance against the word of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Lucifer rewards such dark sacraments handsomely – witches are said to be gifted with unnatural lifespans and all manner of demonic powers.

The Fellowship of Hel are a secret society devoted to the study of dark sorcery and the veneration of the Hel, the giantess ruler of Helheim. Members believe in the power of destruction and will attempt to use dark magic to sate their greed and thirst for death. At Ragnarök they hope to join the forces of Hel and Loke in the fight against the other gods.

Soul Eaters are said to be damned people cursed by witches to forever roam the desert, sustaining themselves upon the souls of unwary travelers. Holding powers beyond the comprehension of ordinary men, these creatures can occasionally find their way into the dark corners of civilized societies, appearing in semblance of mortals to deceive their victims.

Hunters and warriors alike look to [baltic_pagan.GetHighGodName], as the guardian of the woods. Most fighters wear animal pelts for its connection to the wilderness, and they worship trees, as the roots are seen as connected to [baltic_pagan.GetHighGodName]. At the end of the day,the Forest Walkers have but one calling: to protect the forest, the ancestral home and legacy of their ancestors.

Worshiped by hunters and warriors alike, Medeina is the huntress goddess of the forest. Her followers wear wolf-pelts in her image and hold hares holy, as Medeina is known to send the animal out to lure away the unworthy, out of her domain. The warriors of Medeina have one simple calling: to protect the forest, their home and true legacy of their ancestors.

The Light Keepers are the boon of a society of warrior clans surrounding the many [bon_pagan.GetName] monasteries. Possessing a discipline as harsh as the environment they inhabit, these fighters are from a superstitious community and will always make certain to perform the appropriate rites and sacrifices, before each battle.

The Sentinels are the boon of a society of warrior clans surrounding the many Bön monasteries. Possessing a discipline as harsh as the environment of the mountainous plateau they inhabit, these fighters are from a superstitious community and will always make certain to perform the appropriate rites and sacrifices, before each battle.

The [finnish_pagan.GetName] do not even utter the name of the sacred animal, but draw strength from worshiping the bear, calling it 'the King and Queen of the Forest'. After hunting one, a complex ritual must take place, wherein the bear is convinced that it was not slain, but died due to fault of its own, so that its hunters may don themselves in its fur.

The Suomenusko Followers of Otso do not even utter the name of the sacred animal, but draw strength from worshiping the bear, calling it 'the King of the Forest'. After hunting one, a complex ritual must take place, wherein the bear is convinced that it was not slain, but died due to fault of its own, so that its hunters may don themselves in its fur.

The Mountain Guardians train hard and maintain an expert physique, not only for the purpose of battle, but for games of sport – participating is prestigious, and the most skillful of their community are adored by everyone, commoner and noble alike.

The Olympian Champions train hard and maintain an expert physique, not only for the purpose of battle, but for games of sport – participating is prestigious, and the most skillful of their community are adored by everyone, commoner and noble alike.

The Wolf Warriors consist of ferocious men and women fighting for honor and recognition on the battlefield, as well as an ideal of bravery and companionship. In honor of [norse_pagan.GetHighGodName], they wear their pelts into battle, and favor the spear.

The Wolf Warriors, or Úlfhéðnar as they call themselves, consist of ferocious men and women fighting for honor and recognition on the battlefield, as well as an ideal of bravery and companionship. In honor of Odin the Allfather, they wear their pelts into battle, and favor a spear in personal combat.

The members of the Silver Arrowheads worship the thundering skies, and strive to uphold an ideal of honor, guarding their fellow men and women from wrongdoing. Their families are known to hang protective symbols of arrows and bolts by their houses, to grant their heroes luck on the battlefield and shield them from storms.

The valiant Champions of Perun, the Slavic god of thunder, strive to uphold an ideal of honor and guard their fellow men and women from wrongdoing. Their families are known to hang protective symbols of arrows and bolts by their houses, to grant their heroes luck on the battlefield and shield them from storms.

The Eagle Hearts carry on the ancient tradition of training and hunting with birds, the most prestigious type being the golden eagle. The hunters, also known as 'berkutchi', are said to only need three things in life: a fast horse, a faithful dog, and an eagle.

The Eagle Warriors of the steppe carry on the ancient tradition of training and hunting with birds, the most prestigious type being the golden eagle. The hunters, also known as 'berkutchi', are said to only need three things in life: a fast horse, a faithful dog, and an eagle.

Occasionally spotted leaving offerings in the water, the Rain Runners fight and train in the name of [west_african_pagan.GetHighGodName]. When charging into battle, they wear blue and are known to carry small fetish symbols close to their heart.

Occasionally spotted leaving offerings in the rain, the Children of the Storm fight and train in the name of Dongo, the father of storms and god of thunder. When charging into battle, they wear blue and are known to carry small fetish symbols close to their heart.

The sun always watching, the Fire Dancers vow to be a strong as the scorching being in the sky. Spending long hours training and practicing with each other, they are often clad in the colors of flame. Many admire their usage of fire, during their ceremonial fights.

The Zun always watching, the Keepers of the Flame vow to be a strong as their scorching god in the sky. Spending long hours training and practicing with each other, clad in the colors of flame, they are known for their cool determination on the battlefield.

Hermetics believe that there are deeply hidden secrets about this world that only the worthy can uncover. As a member of the Hermetics you will seek the truth in the stars and planets, through diligent experimentation, and by careful interpretation of ancient texts and symbols.

The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] are oblivious fools. §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! leads [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sheepish flock down a path which will only bring weakness and stagnation. It is up to you to give [FromFrom.GetHerHim] a new direction.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Corrupt [FromFrom.Religion.GetPriestTitle]'§! and successfully corrupt [FromFrom.GetHerHim].

The [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s of the [From.GetHolding] of [From.GetName] worship their weak, false [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. Tear down their powerless idols, torch their holy books and steal their riches in honor of [Root.GetDWDevil]! Right-click the title's shield to perform this action.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the title shield of §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!, select §Y'Desecrate Temple'§! and successfully desecrate the [FromFrom.GetHolding] of §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!.
To perform alchemical experiments a member of the Hermetic society has a demand for rare ingredients with specific attributes.
To complete this quest you have to successfully harvest ingredients that can be used in your alchemical experiments.
You must construct a laboratory in which your experiments to uncover the hidden secrets of the universe can be undertaken.
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Construct Laboratory'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully complete the construction of a Laboratory.

Every respectable scholar of the Hermetic arts should take on an apprentice. Alchemical experiments are complex operations which requires extra hands, and what [Root.GetTitle] has enough time to search dusty libraries, shady markets and faraway forests for rare ingredients?
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must either assign an apprentice through the §YMinor Titles§! screen or keep their eyes open for a promising pupil to appear to complete this mission.

Your colleague [FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] has found a letter detailing the possible locations of some great old works of Hermeticism. A deal has been struck – [FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] shall share the contents of the letter with you, and you shall fund the expedition.
If §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! sets out on one of the expeditions suggested by §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! and finds an old hermetic text, the mission is completed.

The greedy and paranoid [FromFrom.GetSocietyRank] [FromFrom.GetFirstName] guards [FromFrom.GetHerHis] secrets jealously. A most shameful behavior, indeed! Unlike [FromFrom.GetHerHim], you know how to share. In the spirit of collaboration, you and a colleague has agreed to infiltrate [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'s laboratory and either steal or destroy anything of value. Perhaps you will do both!
Your colleague will bring you to the laboratory of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!. If you manage to steal or destroy anything and get away unnoticed, the mission is completed.

One cannot fully understand our place in the cosmos if one does not see to the stars. It is said that the stars contain the truth of all things past and all things to come – by solving their riddles, one could predict anything.
To complete this mission you have to carefully study the sky and solve the puzzles that connect the physical world with the astral one.
You must perform a holy pilgrimage to cleanse yourself and to strive to enlightenment.
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Go on Pilgrimage'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully complete a pilgrimage to one a holy site.

An important function of [Root.Society.GetName] is helping those in need. Our ability to perform charity is entirely dependent upon donations from the wealthy. As a powerful ruler you are expected to contribute to this cause.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Donate to Charity'§!.

To bring yourself closer to the divine and the final freedom, you are to seclude yourself to meditate. Spend your days reading [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], saying mantras and contemplating your actions and the universe. During this time, you must live simply and restrict your access to the outside world.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Begin Secluded Meditation'§! in the Intrigue Menu and successfully complete your holy seclusion.
To complete this mission, select §Y'Do Penance'§! in the Intrigue Menu and successfully complete your holy seclusion.

To bring yourself closer to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and repent for your sins, you are to seclude yourself to do penance. Spend your days reading [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], praying to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and contemplating your life and actions. During this time, you must live simply and restrict your access to the outside world.

You must perform a holy pilgrimage to atone for your sins and to reflect upon the greatness of God. This spiritual journey will help you reflect upon yourself and increase your standing with the order.
To complete this mission, activate the decision §Y'Go on a Pilgrimage'§! in the Intrigue menu and successfully complete a pilgrimage to one of the holy cities of Christianity.

Even though a member of [Root.Society.GetName] always keeps their spiritual development in mind, no matter where they go and what they do, there is a time in all of our lives where these matters become even more crucial. It is time for you to focus on theology.
To complete this mission, pick the §Y'Theology'§! focus in the Character screen.
To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! your own portrait and choose §YPrepare Secret Ceremony§!.

It is a challenge to maintain a falsely professed faith at the best of time, but those who would not understand you are more suspicious than ever. You must show them beyond any shadow of a doubt that you believe what you have told them.
Take the decision to Blend In to start your attempt. Successfully convincing those around you that you are a believer of their faith will complete the mission.

To build the strength of our faith, you must spread the word of [Root.SecretReligion.GetScriptureName] as far as it can reach. There is fertile ground within the realm where people seem open to new ideas. Found a community there, and see it blossom.

Use the Prepare Ground power in the province by right-clicking the county shield. This will start your attempt to found a community of believers there. Successfully building a community will complete the mission.

We believe that the [FromFrom.GetTitle] of [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [FromFrom.GetDynName], could be turned into a supporter of our cause. It is your mission to secretly convert [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] to the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] faith.

To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Induct Into the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] Faith'§! and successfully make [FromFrom.GetHerHim] a secret believer of the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] faith. If §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! does not currently have the §YSympathy for [Root.GetTrueReligionGroupPersons]§! trait, §Y'Evoke Sympathy for [Root.GetTrueReligionGroupPersons]'§! must be selected and successfully completed first.\n

The first step towards liberation as well as the religious conversion of lost souls is spreading sympathy for the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] faith. Approach [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] and turn [FromFrom.GetHerHim] into a supporter of our cause.
Evoke the Sympathy of a Ruler

To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Evoke Sympathy for [FromFrom.GetTrueReligionGroupPersons]'§! and successfully make them a supporter of the [Root.TrueReligion.GetName] faith.\n

The Assassins prefer to intimidate their enemies into submission, but a threat is not threatening without any actual weight behind it. Therefore the Order assassinate their biggest enemies publicly to strike fear in the hearts of anyone who dare oppose them. Your mission is to assassinate §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, a punishment for [FromFrom.GetHerHis] crimes against the Order and the True Faith.

To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must successfully complete a murder plot against [Root.GetHerHis] target, §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!. To initiate the plot, select the diplomatic action §Y'Plot to Kill'§! by right-clicking on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.

§Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! borrowed a significant amount of gold from the Order. When it was time to pay it back, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] refused. It is your mission to scare §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! to the point where [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will beg the Order to accept [FromFrom.GetHerHis] money.

To complete this mission, §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! must successfully complete a debt collection plot against [Root.GetHerHis] target, §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!. To initiate the plot, select §Y'Collect Debt from [FromFrom.GetFirstName]'§! in the Intrigue menu.
To complete this mission, the religion of the county [FromFrom.GetName] must become Shia. To convert [FromFrom.GetName], send your court Mullah to §Y'Proselytize'§! there.

To protect the True Faith, the Assassins must sometimes make a preemptive strike against the infidels. You shall attack one of our enemies' key holdings, the [FromFrom.GetHolding] of [FromFrom.GetName] in [FromFrom.Location.County.GetName]. Your mission is completed when the [FromFrom.GetHolding] is under your control.

To complete this mission, declare war on §Y[FromFrom.Holder.Realm.Holder.GetTitledName]§! and siege the holding [FromFrom.GetName] in the county [FromFrom.Location.GetName] until it is under the control of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§!.

The names of some Assassins will live on forever. These extraordinary [Root.GetMenWomen] spent their entire lives studying and practicing the arts of an Assassin – disguise, infiltration, combat, and war strategies, as well as the customs and languages of their enemies. Finding and training the shining star of the next generation is a duty which has fallen upon you.
To complete this mission, the training of a protégé must be initiated and completed. To train a child, §Gright-click§! on their portrait and choose "Train Protégé".

The time has come for the embodied spawn of [Root.GetDWDevil] to enter this world and bring about a new era of glorious majesty. This child will lead humankind to a great future where we, the true followers, shall rule empires. The honor of choosing the unholy mother has fallen upon you.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on a female follower of [Root.GetDWDevil] of child-bearing age in your court and select §Y'Unholy Impregnation'§!

Our almighty [Root.GetDWDevil] needs all sort of servants. For some missions, a true [Root.GetDWMagician] is needed. Other and more menial tasks, however, do not require the same kind of power and wit. Place §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§! under your control and have them carry out [Root.GetDWDevil]'s wishes.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Demonic Possession'§! and successfully enthrall [FromFrom.GetHerHim].

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of a dwarf.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a dwarf and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them someone who pledged their life to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] or an ascetic and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of a powerful ruler.
To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a landed ruler and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!.

The powerful and mighty [Root.GetDWDevil] takes and gives. While we are rewarded with powers far beyond what most kings and queens ever dream of, everything has a price. [Root.GetDWDevil] demands payment in blood and souls. Offer them the life of someone who has never known love.

To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of a prisoner in your dungeons who is a virgin and select §Y'Sacrifice to [Root.GetDWDevil]'§!. Children, chaste and ascetic characters are likely virgins.
It is important to occasionally test one's mettle and prove oneself as a warrior. A straight-forward way is to seek out enemies and deal with them, personally...

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YDuel§! them. The winner will receive the most §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!, while losing and still breathing will mean losing §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!...
Members of warrior lodges often spar with one another, for practice and recreation. It is not a duty one neglects without the notice of one's peers...
To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YDuel§! them. The winner will receive the most §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!.
You must lead your raiders to loot [From.Location.GetName] to prove your worth and gain the riches laying within it.
To complete this mission, personally lead your troops to loot §Y[FromFrom.GetName]§!.
It could be that our descendants follow in our footsteps, but to make certain that the legacy of our Warrior Lodge continues, encouraging our young is key.

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of your target and choose to §YRecruit§! them. If the initiation is successful, you will receive §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. However, if your child fails the initiation duel, the mission fails.
A warrior cannot afford to grow idle, in the comfort of their home! Spreading one's name, as well as domain, is a clear path to glory.

To complete this mission you need to §Gright-click§! on the portrait of the top holder of your target province and choose to §YDeclare War§!, using §YConquest of [From.Location.GetName]§!. The outcome of the war will affect the §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§! gained.
There is a time for fighting and a time for celebrating, and the older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I might be neglecting the latter to focus on other, menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YCarousing Focus§!.
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] have suggested that I spend some time refining my senses by hunting wild game.
To complete this mission, select the §YHunting Focus§!.
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I am neglecting my duties as [Root.GetTitle] to focus on other menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YRulership Focus§!.
The older members of [Root.Society.GetName] are concerned that I might be neglecting my training to focus on other, menial activities.
To complete this mission, select the §YWar Focus§!.
